title: Boston African American National Historic Site: Boston's Crusade Against Slavery Online Exhibition
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture     Boston's Crusade Against Slavery Online Exhibition              The Crusade Against Slavery         An abolitionist broadside featured in the Boston's Crusade Against Slavery exhibition. Houghton Library  Please visit the online exhibition Boston's Crusade Against Slavery.  This project is a student-curated exhibition about Boston's central role in the struggle against slavery.  This course, offered at Harvard University, was facilitated by Professor John Stauffer, Houghton Library staff member Peter X. Accardo, and Boston African American National Historic Site Park Ranger Ryan McNabb during the 2012-2013 academic year.    The online exhibition can be found here.
